item.title: Fast and easy gridding of point data with geopandas
item.description: This post looks at using the geopandas library to do fast efficient gridding of point data onto a regular grid. Geopandas is a python package that provides a geospatial extension to pandas – so that dataframes can store geographic data such as points and polygons.

item.title: Visualising 2 billion pixel rasters with datashader and xarray
item.description: This post looks at visualising large raster datasets with Datashader and xarray.

item.title: ASCII maps of vector files
item.description:
ʕ•ᴥ•ʔ

I recently came across a nice python package for visualising vector data quickly. Of course, an obvious option is to fire up QGIS but often I generate these on a remote server so would like something a little more “text-based”… Then this post highlighted some rather charming tools for generating ASCII rasterisations of vector geometries. I liked the look of the python-based gj2ascii the most.
